intro: Erysimum strophades, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum strophades is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
